DataElement.preferredName: Person Primary Care Evaluation of Mental Disorders Patient Health Questionnaire Total Score Psychometric Questionnaire Two Digit Score
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Numeric value for the total score on the PRIME-MD PHQ-9, a self-administered diagnostic instrument developed for use in Primary Care settings to screen for common mental disorders, including alcohol abuse and dependence.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Person Primary Care Evaluation of Mental Disorders Patient Health Questionnaire Total Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Person; a human being._A self-administered diagnostic instrument developed for use in Primary Care settings to screen for common mental disorders, including alcohol abuse and dependence. (Copyright Pfizer)_To possess every necessary or normal part or component or step; having come or been brought to a conclusion._Pertaining to an entirety or whole, also constituting the full quantity or extent; complete; derived by addition._A numeric or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, or ability. Scores are used to aid in the diagnosis and treatment of a condition. In addition, scores may be part of the inclusion or exclusion criteria of a clinical trial protocol. (NCI)

Concepts.longName: Primary Care Evaluation of Mental Disorders Patient Health Questionnaire
Concepts.definition: A self-administered diagnostic instrument developed for use in Primary Care settings to screen for common mental disorders, including alcohol abuse and dependence. (Copyright Pfizer)

Property.preferredDefinition: Pertaining to an entirety or whole, also constituting the full quantity or extent; complete.:A numeric or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, or ability. Scores are used to aid in the diagnosis and treatment of a condition. In addition, scores may be part of the inclusion or exclusion criteria of a clinical trial protocol. (NCI)

Concepts.definition: Pertaining to an entirety or whole, also constituting the full quantity or extent; complete; derived by addition.

A numeric or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, or ability. Scores are used to aid in the diagnosis and treatment of a condition. In addition, scores may be part of the inclusion or exclusion criteria of a clinical trial protocol. (NCI)

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Assessment of psychological variables by the application of mathematical procedures.:A number with no fractional part.::two:A single character in a numbering system.:A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

Concepts.definition: The science of measuring "psychological" aspects of a person such as knowledge, skills, abilities, or personality. Measurement of these unobservable phenomena is difficult and much of the research and accumulated art of this discipline is designed to reliably define and then quantify.
A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.
A single character in a numbering system.
A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

DataElement.changeDescription: Curated to support NCI CCR brain tumor natural history trial
